#Sheffession9834
Living in the lake district has given me better opportunity than most to get out and about these last few months. The scenic beauty has made my hour of daily exercise far more enjoyable than it would have been for many others trapped in towns and cities. I totally understand why people have been keen to visit beauty spots now that lockdown restrictions are being eased, and I don't begrudge outsiders from visiting to enjoy the scenery. But for anyone that leaves litter out in the countryside (or anywhere else, for that matter), know this: I despise you. You are worse than an animal, and I yearn to see you fail. If you really, really, really feel the need to buy a bag of fucking hula-hoops to carry you through a scenic walk in the country, at least have the decency to carry the empty packet once you've finished. If you don't do this, it proves that you are a bad person and deserve to live in a totalitarian state. Some will argue that this is too harsh; I would argue that they are a blight on the earth.

text:
#Sheffession9779
As a minority, I feel this is an important point to stress. Racist shaming is not the way to go. By forcing people to share your exact views only pushes racist thoughts deeper inside a person. It's important to be able to discuss things without being labelled a racist. Of course we need to address obvious racist actions but we can't change a person's intrinsic views by shaming them when they don't parrot our exact narrative. There are many factors in society that lead to inequality, with racism being one of them. Until we can have an open discussion about it, nothing will change. So please, if someone commits an unforgivable 'microaggression' don't label them a racist and be done with them. Instead, be a friend and talk about it. Society is a lot more complicated than you think.
post_text:
#Sheffession9779

#Sheffession9760
To #Sheffessions9740 although I think your post was well intentioned, I think you have missed the point..
Silence is Violence.
Silence is allowing racism, and frankly all forms of discrimination, to go unchallenged.
The actions you are taking; signing petitions, educating yourself, donating and starting discussions with friends/family are helpful, a good start and meaning that you are NOT being silent.
Reposting things may just come across as virtue signalling, but it actually has positives. Sharing educational resources and showing the overwhelming support behind being anti-racist will help make those fake people actually take some action.
As a POC, the people who need help to unlearn their racist, discriminatory tendencies funnily enough won‚Äôt listen to the likes of me.
Sorry if it‚Äôs an inconvenience for you to see these posts, it‚Äôs a privilege to learn about racism.
What‚Äôs frustrating is having experienced it your whole life and only now seeing active work by some to combat it.

text:
#Sheffession9756
With everyone reading more and educating themselves on black history a lot of us are going to realise that we've done or said racist things that at the time we may not have known were wrong. I also want to remind people of something that I myself am also guilty of: when we make jokes about internationals always being in the diamond booths, always being rich and dressing nicely those are all stereotypes. We hide behind the term 'International students' and make a lot of stereotypes and make racist jokes. We all need to stop and consider how what we say is only a joke to us and can actually be extremely hurtful to the people we stereotype.
Keep educating yourselves keep reading, posting, protesting, donating. It's our responsibility as young people to help change the way society views POC to make the world a fairer and safer place for future generations.

Hey students of Sheffield! You will likely have seen many posts recently detailing ways that you can get involved with the Black Lives Matter movement.
A team of students have developed Write For Change, a website that auto-composes personalised emails to your local MP, in support of the ongoing protests.
Simply go to the website:
https://www.write-for-change.uk/
Enter your name and address (which are NOT stored), and instantly view, edit, and send each email.
Demanding action from our local constituencies is one of the easiest and most effective ways of helping to support the cause, so please spend just one minute of your time to make a difference.

The black lives matter movement is so important and standing up to prejudice needs to be something we all do but lets get some things straight.
"Silence is violence" is not true. Signing petitions, educating yourself, donating and talking to family and friends about this is just as important. Just because you are speaking out on social media and reposting posts that have been shared 100 times before does not make you any better. This is not a fad and we do not need you virtue signalling!
"If you're not angry, you're not paying attention". Its great that this has kicked off but this is nothing new, this is something we all know to happen all the time! Racism is not new and its appalling its taken this long for such a lot of you to finally do something. If youre only angry now, you were never paying attention before!
We are all fighting this together, stop finding ways to pit yourselves against each other! Support the POC in your life and lets change the world for the better.

#Sheffession9717
One of lockdowns biggest struggles is a lack of public toilets. I only discovered this when I went out for a few tinnies with a mate and found myself bursting for a wee on the walk home. It was a 20 minute walk and I knew I couldn't make it. Passing my old school on the main road, I saw my opportunity to go in some the bushes. Checking to see no one was looking, I wondered in. I then realised I was wearing a JUMPSUIT and had to fully strip down, but the situation was urgent so I did the business. I emerged from the bushes as if it were business as usual while people stared at me. At least I was a bit waved so all I felt was pure relief.

#Sheffession9709
Please can people advise me. I'm in a small friendship group, but my friends are 'lads' and are quite racist. They'll never do anything violent, and I do not think they've been racist to people's faces, but they make really vulgar comments and 'jokes' behind people's backs. About individual people and whole cultures. The recent news has taught me that I need to read up more, and learn more about racism - Something important I have learnt is that over the last year, me staying silent as they made comments was not okay. I really am sorry. I know going forward I need to learn more and I need to speak against their actions. The thing is, I have no idea how to do this, I don't know how to make them listen to me. Can anyone advise me how to bring it up affectively?

A message from Sheffield Marrow:
Anthony Nolan is the charity which matches incredible individuals willing to donate their stem cells to patients in need of a stem cell transplant.
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, there has been a huge drop in people registering as a potential stem cell donor and Anthony Nolan urgently need to recruit more potential lifesavers to their register.
If you‚Äôre aged 16-30 and in good health, you can apply to be a lifesaver today.
Joining is simple. To take the first step, go to anthonynolan.org/sheffieldmarrow and fill in an application form or watch this short video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YhIisa9KxIk to find out what stem cell donation involves.
Together, we can save the lives of people with blood cancer.

text:
#Sheffession9671
As it was Mental Health Awareness week last week, many people made brave posts on social media sharing their own experiences and helping to end the stigma. It takes a lot of courage to do that, and sometimes people aren‚Äôt ready to share their story and that‚Äôs okay too. It can be difficult seeing all the praise that someone else is getting, whilst it feels as though no one knows about your struggles. So to those that are silently suffering, just know that you‚Äôre also doing amazing. Keep holding on. There is light at the end of the tunnel, even if you can‚Äôt see it right now or even if you feel like it‚Äôs never ending. Be proud of yourself, even if it feels like no one else is. You‚Äôre doing amazing and help is out there. It‚Äôs not easy to open up but you will get there in time. If you‚Äôre struggling to open up, find ways to channel your emotions instead, whether that‚Äôs through creativity, exercising, writing it out in a journal, etc. You are not alone, and you‚Äôll get to a better place. üí™üèª‚ù§Ô∏è

#Sheffession9654
I‚Äôm still in Sheffield and one of my closest friends is still here living alone in his flat so I‚Äôve tried to make it easier for him checking up on him every few days, calling him at least once a week, sending uplifting pictures, and in the last weeks I went to visit him and shared some cake that I baked. I know this experience can be especially difficult being on his own so I did my best to make it better despite feeling like I was bothering him. Sadly we haven‚Äôt spoken in more than a week because I was feeling a bit down and I asked him if we could talk, he said he was having breakfast but would call me afterwards. Apparently he‚Äôs been having breakfast for a couple of days now. I know it‚Äôs a weird time but after all the support I‚Äôve shown I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs too bad that I need someone to be there for me too. I know he reads sheffessions so I want him to know that everyday that we don‚Äôt talk it‚Äôs because I take the conscious decision to go on with my day despite really wanting to talk to him and share stuff with him because he keeps letting me down.

#Sheffession9646
Being an international student, I literally have to fly out of Sheffield at a few hours notice because of countries literally shutting their borders. Many of us could not clear our rooms out in time. And now the university sends an email saying that we need to either clear our belongings out in 21 days or have a locker storage service do it for us. Where is the understanding that even if we wanted to fly back to Sheffield to collect our belongings- we literally cannot do that right now - and having strangers go through our belongings isn't exactly the best option especially since many people still have valuable documents in their rooms- its a global pandemic and I wish they could give us the option to store our belongings at a cost in the rooms till we are physically able to do something about them

They both got so hammered they could barely walk (it was 9pm). We walked back to endcliff together and he kept trying to give her a piggy back, finally he managed it and then fell smack on his face. Blood everywhere. It was pitch black, like 1 streetlight and he says he is missing a tooth. Here we are looking for a fucking tooth on the floor while he is bleeding everywhere! Miraculously my friend found the tooth (hero) so we go back to endcliff to clean him up- when we get to his flat we realise that the tooth, upon exiting his mouth had gone through that bit of skin under his lip and he had a massive hole. Housemate ends up calling 999 crying, abulance turns up AND THEY ONLY FUCKING KNOW HIS NAME AND RECOGNISE HIM FROM THE COUNTLESS TIMES HE HAS DONE STUFF LIKE THIS BEFORE. Still, at least the housemate didnt cheat on her bf, this time anyway....

#Sheffession9139
This is long overdue but has to be done. Who was staying in Ranmoor this year with a purple light, plants, walking stuff on top of their cupboard, and BIRD PHOTOS on their pinboard !?
Me and my flatmate once went on a lil walk outside past all the flats and, as well as being impressed by the massive ass telescope in someone's kitchen on the ground floor, we couldn't help but notice the purple light. Then we saw the bird photos. As someone who genuinely took part in the RSPB Big Garden Birdwatch ~by themself~ lmao, has a bird poster up in their bedroom, and enjoys walking, I instantly felt connected to this person. Since then I've often wondered whether if we'd have met we would have become friends. So this is a shoutout to the bird fan in the room facing the top car park! Feel free to reveal yourself below!
post_text:
#Sheffession9139
This is long overdue but has to be done. Who was staying in Ranmoor this year with a purple light, plants, walking stuff on top of their cupboard, and BIRD PHOTOS on their pinboard !?
Me and my flatmate once went on a lil walk outside past all the flats and, as well as being impressed by the massive ass telescope in someone's kitchen on the ground floor, we couldn't help but notice the purple light. Then we saw the bird photos. As someone who genuinely took part in the RSPB Big Garden Birdwatch ~by themself~ lmao, has a bird poster up in their bedroom, and enjoys walking, I instantly felt connected to this person. Since then I've often wondered whether if we'd have met we would have become friends. So this is a shoutout to the bird fan in the room facing the top car park! Feel free to reveal yourself below!

text:
#Sheffession9068
So having come back home down south due to a certain global pandemic, my mother thought it would be very apt for us to spread one of our late dogs ashes seeing as all the family was back home.
So having decided where we would spread the ashes we set off bringing our younger dog with us, for a bit of context, the two dogs had a love hate relationship that involved the eldest pissing on the youngest dog numerous times (Yes, I know it's very weird). As we got to the edge of the pond and proceeded to spread the ashes not only did the ashes set off my dads asthma causing him to have a fit, but also our youngest dog proceeded to piss all over his brothers ashes as some sort of weird 'getting his own back' send off to his late brother. It was a very emotional but rather quite fitting send off for such a good boy.
I hope those with dogs out there treasure every moment they get to spend with them.
I miss you big T x
P.S, please enjoy a photo of the two boys on one of the rare occasions that they got along

Hello one n all, in these trying times a lot of people are leaving sheffield and throwing away food etc. so we‚Äôre doing a food collection to give to food banks (that are struggling atm w people hoarding food). We‚Äôre collecting fresh and long life food, washing up liquid, toilet rolls, sanitary products etc. If you or anyone you know is leaving Sheffield, instead of throwing your food out please contact refugees@sheffield.ac.uk or the STAR Sheffield facebook page (or i‚Äôll try comment on this post if it gets posted) and one of us can come pick up whatever you‚Äôve got from your house or wherever and then take it to a foodbank instead !!! please be kind in these wild times and stay strong!!! big love xxx

#Sheffession8968
can I just say how lucky you all are to have a uni that actually cares about its students? I know it's far from perfect, and you all have your grievances, but I'm here on a year abroad from the USA and my home university has responded to this whole situation appallingly - I'm staying here for health/safety reasons but they've threatened to withdraw us and revoke financial aid if we refuse to leave the UK (I'm not the only one in this situation). Uni of has been so supportive of my decision to stay and also communicates far better than my home uni, which is currently kicking all of its students off-campus even if they don't have a place to stay otherwise. this is long, but it's just a thank-you message to the University of Sheffield for not turning its back on its students and for giving them the freedom to make their own decisions and do what they feel most comfortable doing.

text:
#Sheffession8708
A comprehensive ranking of Crookes pubs:
8) The Punchbowl
- I‚Äôve never seen anyone in there.
7) Noah‚Äôs Ark
- The local, it‚Äôs not for students and you‚Äôve got to respect that.
6) Old Grindstone
- Decent after the renovation, could be livelier but the pool tables are always available which is good.
5) The Closed Shop
- A good venue, very nice food. Beer garden is a bit small but it‚Äôs a lovely place for a nice pint.
4) The Springvale
- A good venue which is always lively, if a bit cramped when there‚Äôs a match on. Are the cheap pints worth the walk back up Springvale Road though?
3) Hally House
- Name another pub with as good a selection of board games. The range of pints available is great too. A well deserved 3rd place.
2) The Ball
- The gentrified Grindstone, good pints and good food. Lively, especially on quiz night.
1) Cobden View
- Sheffield‚Äôs hidden gem, a must visit for any student. Put having a pint here on your bucket lists. Tucked away and ambient, great quiz too.

text:
#Sheffession8189
The many stages of revision (a written document of revision procrastination):
Stage one: motivation, the stupid thought that for once in your life you‚Äôre going to begin revision early and not be screwed for exams
Stage two: the time wasting, the knowing that you have PlENty of time before exams so you really don‚Äôt need to work THAT hard, and that those couple nights out are totally acceptable
Stage three: pressure, the realisation that exams are MUCH closer than they were two weeks ago and you really need to up your game
Stage four: the procrastination, revision is hard, can you really be bothered with this?
Stage five: the screw up, I hate my degree, there‚Äôs no point to this world, I don‚Äôt care, revision is stupid
Stage six: cramming, my exam is tomorrow, revision really isn‚Äôt stupid, I care quite a lot
Stage seven: acceptance, the exam is over. I‚Äôm fucked.
Stage eight: no-one really knows, by this point you should be wasted in the club, drunk off forgetting about the hellish exam

We found out from a drunk conversation in the bathroom at Leadmill after only having met once or twice in passing before. From there, a beautiful friendship was born - built on a firm foundation of being sick of fuckboys.
Fast forward a year and we're now dating exclusively. And, I'm pleased to say, the sex is way better than what either of us got from him.
Moral of the story: don't do people dirty or they'll drop you for each other x

Now that the festive season is over here is a friendly reminder not to be a dick in exam season
1) in the library, don‚Äôt desk hog and leave your stuff overnight
(If you‚Äôre a first year seriously just use your big ol desks in halls, you‚Äôll understand the pain next year)
2) get enough sleep!
3) let your flat mates get enough sleep! Seriously don‚Äôt b loud late into the night if someone is trying to sleep next door
4) don‚Äôt shit on someone‚Äôs revision habits - if they wanna go to the library over night or not revise at all let them we‚Äôre all adults here and it‚Äôs none of ur business
5) take breaks - it‚Äôs good for your mental health and your learning
6) plan something fun to do after, it‚Äôll help get u through
Good luck everyone

Last year, my vegan friend from back home came to Sheffield for one night. As a good friend, I whacked some vegan chicken nuggets in the oven for dinner and she gave me 3 hours of "why isn't everyone vegan" and "vegan meat actually tastes like real meat nowadays"... little did she know that I had accidentally bought the wrong packet and she was actually engulfing a whole plate of normal chicken nuggets... but gluten-free. To this day she still asks me what brand were those "delicious nuggets".

text:
#Sheffession6625
I met a student from a Hallam land,
Who said‚Äî‚ÄúTwo vast and gormless bouncers
Stand in the city. . . . Near them, on the concrete,
Half sunk a shattered club lies, whose entry-fee,
And wrinkled sign, and sneer of older men,
Tell that its owner well his audience read
Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless ket-heads,
The nose that snorted, and the mouth that drank;
And on the doors, these words appear:
My name is Corporation, King of Clubs;
Look on my Pints, ye freshers, and despair!
No-one beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare
The lone and level streets stretch far away.‚Äù

UoS and Hallam rivalry has been heating up recently, yet no one is moving past the same old insults.
I propose an all out ROAST BATTLE, which should be scored much like tennis...
Rules:
-Tag each as #Roast for clarity.
-Each roast must contain which uni it originated from or which uni it‚Äôs being served/returned to.
-Pretty obvious but the better roasts are the ones with most reacts.
-Number of reacts on a roast to be confirmed 48 hours after initially posted.
-Voters mustn‚Äôt be biased, vote purely on the funniest digs.
-A uni wins a point by having the best 3 successive roasts (like a rally), judged by which unis 3 roasts score/add up higher.
-Roasts don‚Äôt have to be true, (I know some of you are a bit tetchy)
I wanna see some quality content, good old ‚Äúyour momma jokes‚Äù etc.
-Only a single match is played. That‚Äôs a minimum of 24 roasts in total.
-As in tennis, winner must win with 2 points ahead, so this could take a while.
Whose to serve?

#Sheffession5708
Losing weight when you go to uni is impossible.
September you‚Äôre getting settled, getting used to a routine can‚Äôt go to hard.
Before you know it it‚Äôs Halloween and everyone‚Äôs drinking loads so you can‚Äôt really try and lose that beer belly then.
Bam, it‚Äôs December and no one can lose weight at Christmas.
January, you wanna get that new year push but EXAMS, New Years resolutions become impossible.
Then you blink and it‚Äôs Easter: chocolate and more alcohol.
Finally exams get you again and by summer you‚Äôre a stone heavier and can just about lose that to return to your starting weight; while working full time to pay for this torture we call uni. Then it all starts again in September.

I work at a popular casual dining chicken restaurant and we run our chicken levels low at night in order to reduce waste, so if someone comes in at say, 9:30, the chances are we‚Äôll have to cook a fresh chicken off to serve - something that takes around half an hour. So if someone comes in around 9:30ish, by the time the chicken comes out the oven we‚Äôll be closed. Needless to say this slows down our close and is a very frustrating thing to do. On one occasion, I dropped a freshly cooked off chicken on the floor... which I promptly picked up and served to the type of self-righteous prick who thinks it‚Äôs okay to come into a restaurant so close to its closing time.
Moral of the story - stay vigilant guys and look out for bits of floor fluff and shite on your food next time you eat your late night peri-peri hit

Here's how I discovered this heinous crime: A few weeks ago, I went into karaoke on a Thursday evening, having just rediscovered this gem of a song ever since I forgot about it since the end of the 2018 World Cup. Looking through the songbook, I quickly realised that this masterpiece was missing. When I asked the DJ about it, he told me in no uncertain terms "Sorry mate, that song has been banned". Banned? BANNED?! Oh I'm sorry, I didn't realise I was paying 9k a year to live in Soviet Russia.

text:
#Sheffession4502 library power moves (only kings have done them all):
- full suit/pajama set (one extreme or the other)
- pulling out a full pint of milk, cereal, bowl, spoon
- taking a mug with you and pouring your tea/coffee into said mug
- when someone says they're saving a seat for a friend, you ignore them completely and sit down regardless (extra points for when they're friend shows up and you see the look of disappointment on their face)
- sitting in front of a desktop with a laptop, and then double screening (one for work, one for tv)
- leaving your stuff and your desk all the time, and only returning when you want to work
- taking off shoes AND socks
- kicking out a-level students in western bank
- throwing children out of western bank
- sitting down in the ic lift and using it as a study space because the library is THAT full
- becoming nocturnal and sleeping during daylight hours and working when its dark
- drinking directly out of a bottle of wine in full view of everyone
- taking a sleeping bag to the library so that you won't lose your sleep

text:
#Sheffession4288 We‚Äôre all familiar with Sheff Sweats, but let me propose a new term - IC Sweats.
IC Sweats are experienced during the first 5 minutes of being in the IC as you are frantically scanning every inch of the building looking for a spare seat. The sweats are brought on by a mixture of things: the outrageously high temperature in there, the nervousness of not finding a seat and having to bolt it up and down those flights of stairs.
The IC Sweats subside once you have found your seat, you take off some layers and give yourself a bit of time to recover from the mini workout that was securing your study space.
post_text:
#Sheffession4288 We‚Äôre all familiar with Sheff Sweats, but let me propose a new term - IC Sweats.
IC Sweats are experienced during the first 5 minutes of being in the IC as you are frantically scanning every inch of the building looking for a spare seat. The sweats are brought on by a mixture of things: the outrageously high temperature in there, the nervousness of not finding a seat and having to bolt it up and down those flights of stairs.
The IC Sweats subside once you have found your seat, you take off some layers and give yourself a bit of time to recover from the mini workout that was securing your study space.

text:
#Sheffession4286 Okay so I have to start this off by saying I've handed in my last assignment and now finished uni... But before you hate me, listen to this piece of advice.
A few weeks ago I was in the middle of dissertation writing and still had an assignment left to write, I was hating myself, hating uni and basically hating life. But all I needed to get through it was 2 mantra's.
1. A count down til it was all over eg. Only 3 weeks till it's done (can also be done in days as well)
2. The knowledge that all the work no matter how horrible wouldn't kill me. I wasn't going to drop dead from writing an assignment and I knew even if I failed that it didn't mean my actual life was over. I'd still be alive.
So I guess my advice is the pain and anxiety of exams and assessment is temporary and it doesn't end the most important thing you have, your life. So no matter how many sleepless nights, how much you want to quit, please keep that in your mind.
Yours truly, a 3rd year whose now finished and has to actually start proper adult life now xox
P.S You Got This!!!!!!

text:
#Sheffession4173 So, I‚Äôve seen a few sheffessions where people talk about random people they see all the time around campus. But you get the same thing on the train when you commute in, and it can be really helpful.
One day, the local train that I get on was on a different platform to usual, and I, being the crippling over thinker that I am, got concerned that I was on the wrong train.
So I start looking around.
‚ÄòOh look, there‚Äôs bald patch man, he gets off at a stop on my route.‚Äô
‚ÄòAnd there‚Äôs posh rucksack guy, he gets off at the stop before me.‚Äô
‚ÄòYes, and there‚Äôs wonky eye with a definite energy drink and drug addiction who I‚Äôm 99% sure will murder me one day guy, who gets off at my stop.‚Äô
And then I could relax into my train ride, albeit a tad concerned that today could be the day that wonky eye guy finally does me in.

text: #Sheffession3645 This one time me and my flatmate went on a night out. My flatmate had drunk loads but I was too busy paying attention to the lad I was dancing with. After a while I begin to wonder where she had gone. I could not find her on the dance floor, the bathroom nor the bar. So I went outside and saw her standing next to the bouncer crying her eyes out. I go up to her and she says "I got kicked out" and I asked the bouncer why that happened. He looked at me and said "Because she tried to go behind the bar to mix her own drink". I don't know about you, but that is actually the best reason to ever get kicked out of a bar/club

text:
#Sheffession3722 Went into my flat mates room to wake him up for his exam, as I walked in I happened to sneeze and reached for the nearest tissue. At this point I was stood next to his bed and with very poor judgement decided the scrunched up tissue on his desk was a safe option. It was when I pressed the tissue over my mouth and nose that I released my mistake, a big load of his fresh spunk went straight up my nose. In a spur of disgust and surprise I dropped the tissue and sneezed again sending a projectile of spunk-snot mixture out of my nose onto my unsuspecting flatmates face.
A shame really that the first persons face I would spunk on happens to be my male flat mate.

1. Buy a fedora, to show that you have class & monetary prospects.

3. Girls like a man who isn't afraid to show their feminine side; if you show her your collection of My Little Pony figurines she'll admire your confidence.
4. When in public with her, draw as much attention to yourself as you possibly can. Incoherent screaming, flailing , and colourful clothing means that all eyes will be on you, like the alpha male you are.
5. If you make a mistake and upset her, tell her that you've only following a Pick-up artist guide you found on the Internet. This way you deflect responsibility, and she can't remain angry at you for long.
This is personal experience talking.

text: #Sheffession3160 coming to the end of a pretty decent roar night, I'm sat just at the exit when I see a guy sat on the side, head between his knees and not moving. instantly I think, fuck maybe he's taken something. so I go up to him and try speak to him, get no response to anything I say until I ask if he wants water and he nods. so I pace to the bar and return, thank fuck he's still there so I give him the water and I mean I tilt his head back for him and pour it into his mouth. after a few sips he stops and puts his head back in his hands and stops responding. at this point I'm pretty sure there's something more than alcohol involved so I get his phone out his pocket and try to get hold his friends. after about five minutes his friend shows up out of nowhere, so I ask if he's taken anything. and his mate says "na na na, it's heartbreak." and the boy gets up and walks away perfectly fine.

text: #Sheffession2023 I feel it is a necessity to inform the wider uni of Sheffield population the absolutely gross error of judgement it is to live in catered accommodation and the utter NONCES that come with it. One boy in my flat broke the kitchen kettle by pouring milk in it to make hot chocolate, and a few months later I hear he's trying to jam a knife down the toaster because he thought that was the only way to get the bread out. Once a girl in my kitchen asked why the tin foil she put in the microwave set on fire, as though it had done it of its own accord. On top of that i have been woken to the sounds of hoovering at 3 am, and the main staircase in our building that everyone had to go up was covered in vomit for a little under a week. Oh and I nearly forgot about the guy who used to run up and down everyday in the courtyard fully dressed in an anorak for no apparent reason. Catered accommodation and lunatic asylum really should be synonyms in the new dictionary.

text:
#Sheffession789 I took my mates from home out on a society bar crawl; I was told that they were my responsibility.
One lost their wallet, half lost their Poptarts ticket, another picked a fight with a union bouncer and got dragged away. One lad though, went missing after being left for about a minute - and never turned up.
Come the next day we comb Weststreet trying to find him, and about midday get a call from the bloke who had hit him in his car.
Panicked, we get a taxi to hospital, only to get another call from my housemate saying that some fella in a blood caked hospital gown is loitering outside the house.
None of them will come to Sheffield now, weirdly.
